Multiple Choice Question: Exactly ONE of the answers provided is correct. There is no partial credit in this questions.

A random variable \(X\) can take on one of the values \(\{1,3,5\}\) with (discrete) probabilities \(p(1) = 1/2\), \(p(3) = 1/4\), \(p(5)=1/4\). The mean value of \(X\) is then

i. \(5/2\)

ii. \(9\)

iii. \(3\)

iv. \(2/5\)

v. \(1\)
